result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb S. Mathison in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Caleb S. Mathison. V. Girard - Clerk 
State - there is an agreement
Atty Krische - will be a DAGP
State - plea to count in complaint - do have victim statements
Atty Krische - that is agreement
Deft - enters a plea of Guilty to Ct 1, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea

Court - finds waivers & plea knowingly & voluntary, finds factual basis & approves stip by parties
  Will not accept plea but approves DAGP
VIS read
Court - believes victim & family is not in agreement with State's resolution
State - that is correct - makes statements 
Court - will approve agreement  - seal VIS from public view 
  Approves agreement & signs order - bond cont
